result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Liborio Perez-Chavez Jr

defendant.name: Perez-Chavez, Liborio, Jr
defendant.address: 3124 West Saint Paul Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53208

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Liborio Perez-Chavez Jr in court.  Attorney John M Binder for Anthony D Cotton in court for Liborio Perez-Chavez Jr.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for motion hearing. Defense filed motion to suppress fruits of invalid warrant. Motion hearing proceeded. Arguments placed on the record. For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion to suppress all fruits of the defective search warrant. Defense requested status conference date. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's Reply to Defense Motion to Suppress Fruits of in Valid Warrant.  Received and Signed.

Defendant Liborio Perez-Chavez in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Liborio Perez-Chavez and Attorney Francesco Mineo appeared by video means. Defense has filed a motion and is requesting a hearing. Court sets 08/23/22 by 5:00 pm as the deadline for the State to reply. Court sets 09/06/2022 by 5:00 pm as the deadline to file any final response. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Fruits of Invalid Warrant.  Received and Filed.  nk

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Liborio Perez-Chavez in court with attorney John Binder on behalf of Anthony D Cotton.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery, with the exception of body camera footage. Further, defense is requesting a Status Conference date for additional time to review with client. Court grants request and sets 07/07/2022 deadline for filing any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bond removed from this case, it not the same person.  (twin brother)

Defendant Liborio Perez-Chavez in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  BOTH APPEARED BY VIDEO.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16 by Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 032404,
Payable Number: 997635,
Receipt Number: 22RP013779,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

10:13 AM Defendant Liborio Perez-Chavez in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Defendant Liborio Perez-Chavez in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Liborio Perez-Chavez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Milwaukee County Sheriff Dept on 03/25/2022
